abstract: The paper is introducing a 6 p.m. press time for its front section and an inside section of late-breaking news, to go to press at 11:30 p.m.
snippet: The paper is introducing a 6 p.m. press time for its front section and an inside section of late-breaking news, to go to press at 11:30 p.m.
lead_paragraph: For generations, newspapers have tried to cut the time between printing and delivery, giving readers the latest news  especially on big stories that often land on the front page. The Los Angeles Times is about to take a big step in the other direction.

headline.main: Los Angeles Times Sets Early Press Time for First Section and Starts Late News Pages
headline.print_headline: Los Angeles Times Sets Early Press Time for First Section and Starts Late News Pages
